questions.clue: This vinegar-flavored rice is the key ingredient in sushi, holding it all together.
While sushi is primarily associated with Japan, this Korean dish is often confused with sushi for its similar appearance.

This term refers to the art of making sushi, a skill that traditionally takes years to perfect in Japan.

This iconic Chinese structure, visible from space, was built to protect against invasions from the north.

This UNESCO World Heritage site in Cambodia is the largest religious monument in the world, originally constructed as a Hindu temple.
A symbol of Korean resilience and innovation, this fortress in Suwon was constructed in the late 18th century during the Joseon Dynasty.
This historic site in Kyoto, Japan, known for its zen rock garden, is a prime example of a Muromachi period temple.
This technology company, known for its iPhones and Mac computers, was founded by Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak, and Ronald Wayne in 1976.
This form of currency, started with Bitcoin in 2009, operates on a technology called blockchain.
This type of AI, which stands for 'generative pre-trained transformer,' powers many language models today, including ChatGPT.
Developed in South Korea, this technology uses a conveyor belt to deliver sushi to diners' tables.
This innovative material, used in flexible electronics and hailed for its strength and conductivity, is composed of a single layer of carbon atoms.
In Greek mythology, this king of the gods is known for wielding a thunderbolt.
This Norse god, associated with thunder and lightning, wields a hammer named Mjolnir.
In Japanese mythology, this sun goddess is considered the most important kami and shines light on the world.
In Korean mythology, this bear transformed into a woman after surviving on a diet of garlic and mugwort, eventually giving birth to Dangun, the founder of Gojoseon.
This creature from Japanese folklore is said to have the ability to shapeshift, and is commonly depicted as a mischievous fox.

final.clue: This Korean dish, often compared to Japanese sushi, features rice and a variety of ingredients rolled in seaweed, but typically doesn't use raw fish.
